sen.j: 特記事項
sen.e: Special notice
Special notice
Remarks

sen.j: 西京区（にしきょうく）は、京都市を構成する11区のひとつ。
sen.e: Nishikyo Ward is one of the eleven wards in Kyoto City.
Nishikyo Ward is one of the eleven wards in Kyoto City.
Nishikyo Ward is one of the eleven wards that constitute Kyoto City.

sen.j: 桂川以西の西京区と、乙訓郡（向日市・長岡京市を含む）をあわせて、西ヶ岡あるいは西山とよばれる。
sen.e: The combined area of the part of Nishikyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River and Otokuni-gun (including Muko City and Nagaokakyo City) is referred to as Nishigaoka or Nishiyama.
The combined area of the part of Nishikyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River and Otokuni-gun (including Muko City and Nagaokakyo City) is referred to as Nishigaoka or Nishiyama.
The combined area of the part of Nishikyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River and Otokuni-gun (including Muko City and Nagaokakyo City) is referred to as Nishigaoka or Nishiyama.

sen.j: 山科区と同時に誕生した、京都市で最も新しい区のひとつである。
sen.e: Being established at the same time as Yamashina Ward, Nishikyo Ward is one of the oldest wards.
Being established at the same time as Yamashina Ward, Nishikyo Ward is one of the oldest wards.
Being established at the same time as Yamashina Ward, Nishikyo Ward is one of the newest wards.

sen.j: 地理
sen.e: Geography
Geography
Geography

sen.j: 河川：桂川 (淀川水系)、小畑川
sen.e: Rivers: Katsura-gawa River and Obata-gawa River
sen.cmt: 原文には、「桂川(淀川水系)」 とありますが、(淀川水系)はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が桂川だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: Rivers: Katsura-gawa River and Obata-gawa River
Rivers: Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) and Obata-gawa River
sen.cmt: 淀川水系 追加しました。

sen.j: 山 ポンポン山 (近畿)、松尾山 (京都府)
sen.e: Mountains: Mt. Ponpon-yama and Mt. Matsuo-yama
sen.cmt: 原文には、「ポンポン山 (近畿)」 とありますが、(近畿)はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が桂川だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。松尾山 (京都府):同上
sen.e: Mountains: Mt. Ponpon-yama and Mt. Matsuo-yama
Mountains: Mt. Ponpon (Kinki) and Mt. Matsuo (Kyoto Prefecture)
sen.cmt: カッコ内を追加しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 古来より現在の西京区や右京区を含む地域には、渡来系の一族である秦氏が居住していた。
sen.e: An immigrant clan of the Hata clan had settled in the area containing the present-day Nishikyo and Ukyo Wards since ancient times.
An immigrant clan of the Hata clan settled in the area containing the present-day Nishikyo and Ukyo Wards since ancient times.
An immigrant clan of the Hata clan settled in the area containing the present-day Nishikyo and Ukyo Wards since ancient times.

sen.j: この秦氏の氏寺的な存在が右京区の広隆寺で、祭祀が行われたのが松尾大社であると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the Koryu-ji Temple acted almost as if it had been their uji-dera (clan temple), and that the Matsuo-taisha Shrine held rituals for the clan.
It is said that the Koryu-ji Temple acted almost as if it had been their uji-dera (clan temple), and that the Matsuo-taisha Shrine held rituals for the clan.
It is said that the Koryu-ji Temple acted almost as if it had been their uji-dera (clan temple), and that the Matsuo-taisha Shrine held rituals for the clan.

sen.j: 西京区の山田地区には秦河勝末孫の東家の墓が京都市街を見守るように立っている。
sen.e: The tomb of the To family (東家), descendants of the HATA no Kawakatsu, stands in the Yamada area in Nishikyo Ward as if it watched over the urban area of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 東家→Toke[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: The tomb of the To family (東家), descendants of the HATA no Kawakatsu, stands in the Yamada area in Nishikyo Ward, almost as if watching over the urban area of Kyoto.
The tomb of the To family (東家), descendants of the HATA no Kawakatsu, stands in the Yamada area in Nishikyo Ward, almost as if watching over the urban area of Kyoto.

sen.j: 秦氏は5世紀頃に桂川の治水工事を行っていたらしいが、西京区の桂川沿岸では洪水がたびたび起こったという。
sen.e: The Hata clan is believed to have improved the Katsura-gawa River around the fifth century, but the river is said to have been flooded repeatedly around the riverside in Nishikyo Ward.
The Hata clan is believed to have improved the Katsura-gawa River around the fifth century, but the river is said to have been flooded repeatedly around the riverside in Nishikyo Ward.
The Hata clan is believed to have improved the Katsura-gawa River around the fifth century, but the river is said to have been flooded repeatedly around the riverside in Nishikyo Ward.

sen.j: 行政区画としては平地部は葛野郡、山手は乙訓郡と分かれて存在していた。
sen.e: As administrative districts, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun were each located separately on the plane and on the mountain side.
As administrative districts, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun were each located separately on the plane and on the mountain side.
As administrative districts, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun were each located separately on the plane and on the mountain side.

sen.j: 平安時代には桂女という女性の商人が洛中に行商を行った。
sen.e: In the Heian period, female traveling merchants called 'Katsurame' peddled in Rakuchu (central Kyoto).
In the Heian period, female traveling merchants called 'Katsurame' peddled in Rakuchu (central Kyoto).
In the Heian period, female traveling merchants called 'Katsurame' peddled in Rakuchu (central Kyoto).

sen.j: 丹波国との国境の大枝には酒呑童子の鬼が居たと言われ（但し、この大江は大江町であると言う説もある）、源頼光によって討伐されたという伝説がある。
sen.e: A demon called Shuten-doji is said to have lived in Oe on the border with Tanba Province although some believe the Oe indicated to the different location of Oe-cho; according to a legend, Shuten-doji was subdued by MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu.

A demon called Shuten-doji is said to have lived in Oe on the border with Tanba Province although some believe the Oe indicated a different location of Oe-cho; according to a legend, Shuten-doji was subdued by MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu.

A demon called Shuten-doji is said to have lived in Oe on the border with Tanba Province although some believe the Oe indicated a different location of Oe-cho; according to a legend, Shuten-doji was subdued by MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu.

sen.j: このほか当区内の由緒ある寺社と言えば藤原氏の祀社・春日神社、善峰寺、樫原廃寺跡などがある。
sen.e: Additionally, historic temples and shrines such as Fujiwara family's branch shrine, the Kasuga-jinja Shrine, the Yoshimine-dera Temple and the Katagihara-haiji Ato (site of the Katagihara dilapidated Temple) are located in Nishikyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 祀社→Shisha[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: Additionally, historic temples and shrines such as Fujiwara family's branch shrine, the Kasuga-jinja Shrine, the Yoshimine-dera Temple and the Katagihara-haiji Ato (site of the Katagihara dilapidated Temple) are located in Nishikyo Ward.

Additionally, historic temples and shrines such as Fujiwara clan's branch shrine, the Kasuga-jinja Shrine, the Yoshimine-dera Temple and the Katagihara-haiji Ato (site of the Katagihara dilapidated Temple) are located in Nishikyo Ward.

sen.j: 京都に政権中枢があった室町時代には、将軍足利義満の時代に、征夷大将軍直属の軍勢として西ヶ岡土豪衆を中心に「奉公衆」が結成された。
sen.e: In the rein of Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA during the Muromachi period when the capital was located in Kyoto, the forces under the direct control of the Sei Taishogun (Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo), 'Hokoshu' (literally vassal group) were organized mainly from local powerful clans in Nishigaoka.

Under the rein of Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA during the Muromachi period when the capital was located in Kyoto, forces under the direct control of the Sei Taishogun (Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo), 'Hokoshu' (literally vassal group) were organized mainly from local powerful clans in Nishigaoka.

Under the rein of Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA during the Muromachi period when the capital was located in Kyoto, forces under the direct control of the Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians"), 'Hokoshu' (literally vassal group) were organized mainly from local powerful clans in Nishigaoka.
sen.cmt: seii としました。 "(Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo)"→"(literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians")"に変更しました。

sen.j: 彼らは明徳の乱や応仁の乱など市街地が舞台となった合戦で活躍し、応仁の乱では細川勝元の指示で大内政弘を攻撃するなど、室町政界に参与した。
sen.e: They excelled in the urban battles in the Meitoku no Ran (Meitoku Rebellion) and the Onin no Ran (Onin War), and during the Onin no Ran, they attacked Masahiro OCHI under the order of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, playing a part in the Muromachi political arena.

They excelled in the urban battles in the Meitoku no Ran (Meitoku Rebellion) and the Onin no Ran (Onin War). During the Onin no Ran, they attacked Masahiro OUCHI under the order of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, playing a part in the Muromachi political arena.

They excelled in the urban battles in the Meitoku no Ran (Meitoku Rebellion) and the Onin no Ran (Onin War): during the Onin no Ran, they attacked Masahiro OUCHI under the order of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, playing a part in the Muromachi political arena.
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には山陰街道が現在の西京区域を横断するように敷かれ、沿道の桂や樫原・大枝は宿場町として栄えた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, the Sanin Highway ran across the present-day Nishikyo Ward, and Katsura and the Katagihara and Oe areas along the highway prospered as the shukuba-machi (post stations).
In the Edo period, the Sanin Highway ran across the present-day Nishikyo Ward, and Katsura and the Katagihara and Oe areas along the highway prospered as the shukuba-machi (post stations).
In the Edo period, the Sanin-kaido Road ran across the present-day Nishikyo Ward, and Katsura and the Katagihara and Oe areas along the road prospered as the shukuba-machi (post stations).

sen.j: また山陰街道脇に桂宮が桂離宮を建設し在住した。
sen.e: Prince Katsura had the Katsura Rikyu (Katsura Imperial Villa) built on the Sanin Highway and resided there.
Prince Katsura had the Katsura Rikyu (Katsura Imperial Villa) built on the Sanin Highway and resided there.
Prince Katsura had the Katsura Rikyu (Katsura Imperial Villa) built on the Sanin-kaido Road and resided there.

sen.j: また、桂は保津川水運の発着所ともなった。
sen.e: Katsura also served as an arrival and departure port for water transport via the Hozu-gawa River.
Katsura also served as an arrival and departure port for water transport via the Hozu-gawa River.
Katsura also served as an arrival and departure port for water transport via the Hozu-gawa River.

sen.j: 1976年（昭和51年）10月1日 右京区から桂川以西を分区して西京区が誕生
sen.e: The portion of Ukyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River was separated to establish Nishikyo Ward on October 1, 1976.
The portion of Ukyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River was separated to establish Nishikyo Ward on October 1, 1976.
The portion of Ukyo Ward to the west of the Katsura-gawa River was separated to establish Nishikyo Ward on October 1, 1976.

sen.j: 右京区から分区した名残で、西京区の担当集配郵便局は、洛西地区（洛西郵便局）を除いて右京区内にある右京郵便局または京都西郵便局の管轄となっている。
sen.e: Collection and delivery in Nishikyo Ward except the Rakusai area (Rakusai Post Office) is operated by Ukyo Post Office and Kyoto West Post Office in Ukyo Ward due to the history of Nishikyo Ward's separation from Ukyo Ward.

Collection and delivery in Nishikyo Ward except the Rakusai area (Rakusai Post Office) is operated by Ukyo Post Office and Kyoto West Post Office in Ukyo Ward due to the history of Nishikyo Ward's separation from Ukyo Ward.

Collection and delivery in Nishikyo Ward except the Rakusai area (Rakusai Post Office) is operated by Ukyo Post Office and Kyoto West Post Office in Ukyo Ward due to the history of Nishikyo Ward's separation from Ukyo Ward.
